page.syntax: Regular_Expression as C = ui_regex_builder([C expression [,C regex_type [,C regex_syntax [,L ignore_case [,C test_text [,C replacement_string ]]]]]])

argument.name: Regular_Expression
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". A properly formatted regular expression for subsequent use.

argument.name: expression
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The search or matching text.

argument.name: ignore_case
argument.description:
Optional. Default = .F. . The options are:
.T. = Case sensitive
.F. = Case insensitive

argument.name: test_text
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". Text to test against the expression that you compose.

argument.name: replacement_string
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The replacement text for replace and split operations.

page.description: A tool for building and testing regular expressions.
page.discussion: The UI_REGEX_BUILDER() function displays the Regular Expression Tester, which helps you build and test regular expressions. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

item.description: Enter the data that you want to search for in the Regular Expression field.
Optionally, select elements from the drop down list and click Insert.
Select Yes or No in the Case sensitive field.
For Expression type, select one of the following:
If you selected Replace in step 4, make a selection from:
If you selected Replace or Split in step 4, enter a value in the Replacement String field.
Optionally, enter a representative text sample in the Test string field. The result of the regular expression will appear in the Result field.
Click close window button to generate the regular expression.
